subject: Communication
title: Confirmation Bias in Listening
description: A quick win: understand Confirmation Bias in Listening.

hook.text: Two people hear the same speech. One calls it inspiring, the other calls it dangerous. Same words. Different filters.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias in listening: we selectively attend to, interpret, and remember parts of a message that confirm our.

discovery.text: In a study, partisans watching the same debate each believed their candidate won â€” because they filtered for.

twist.text: We don't just filter what we hear. We actively reconstruct memories of conversations to match our beliefs.

climax.text: Fighting confirmation bias in listening requires asking: 'What am I not hearing? What would change my mind?

punchline.text: If you only hear what you already believe, you're not listening. You're echoing.
